item.description:
Learn to make goat cheese for home consumption from our friends Margaret Hathaway and Karl Schatz at their farm in New Gloucester. Our hosts will share their experiences and recipes for at least two goat cheeses (the Manchacha and the fresh chevre that many of us sampled at the February meetup.) We will use goat's milk to make two types of cheese and attendees will bring home samples of both. To learn more about Margaret and Karl click here.

9:00 am Meet at the Marginal Way Park-and-Ride (just north of Franklin Arterial)
10:00 am Workshop to start (coffee/tea/morning snack provided)
1:00 pm Potluck Lunch (bring a dish to share)
4:00 pm Wrap-up Workshop followed by optional milking of the goats for those who are interested!

Cost is $49 per person for the full-day workshop, including handouts, supplies and coffee/tea/snacks.
Pay here by PayPal or print the registration form and send in with check. Payment must be received by March 23rd.

*If you plan to carpool, make sure you post http://www.meetup.com...

Please see our Meetup Event RSVP Guidelines:
http://permaculture.m...

Consider bringing your digital camera and posting up a few photos after the event!
Please remember to bring your own potluck kit (plate/bowl/utensils/cup/napkin)!
Potluck food safety ideas here: http://fycs.ifas.ufl....
